Greeting to the group!

I have a project which I would like to tackle and n=
eed opinions on the best way(s) to go about it. 

The scope of the project =
would be relatively simple - something like this:
Archive well less than 1,=
000 total sites which focus on a particular type of content - mostly user t=
o user sites (forums, etc.) about, for instance, boats. 
The archived sites=
 would not be used until and unless the existing sites ceased to exist. The=
 archive would exist only for that reason - to make certain some content di=
d not go to the great digital trash can in the sky. I would only need to cr=
awl these sites once a year or so as they contain relatively timeless conte=
nt (how to wire a Boston Whaler boat, for instance)...

The archiving progr=
am or a post-processor must have the ability to convert dynamic sites (foru=
ms, etc.) to static pages which would run without dependencies. 

So, my in=
itial questions:

1. What would be the best crawler or SW to use to do this=
? I've seen stuff like httrack and heretrix as well as some small programs =
(sitesucker, etc.) which run on a mac, etc.

2. Will advanced configuration=
 be needed for each and every site I desire to download? Further to this qu=
estion, have folks written extensions which, for instance, might be designe=
d to best download a site which runs on VBB (a popular forum package)....or=
 do we each have to reinvent the wheel?

3. Further to #2, do y'all work wi=
th other programs to massage the data afterwards....as an example, strip ou=
t the ads, etc.?

I run a dedicated centos server which could run the crawl=
er...or, I could run it on my home machine or another barebones server whic=
h I hook up at home. Given the relatively small number of sites I intend to=
 archive (probably only 200-300 a year at first), this might work out.

Any=
 and all advice appreciated. I would like to avoid as many errors and misst=
eps as possible.
